Activity: Check emails and respond to any vendor replies regarding the meeting request. Finalize the meeting date and time, sending out a formal meeting invitation with an agenda. Need coffee first though.

Refine the document outlining the hospital's requirements, focusing on clarity and conciseness. Ensure all key stakeholders' needs are addressed. Send to @his-1 and @his-2 for a quick review and feedback. Topic: Review of EHR Modification Requirements Document.

Contact @ehrdev-1 and @ehrdev-2 to discuss potential integration challenges with the proposed system modifications. Gather their insights on the technical feasibility of the required changes. Topic: EHR Modification Integration Feasibility.
Research alternative EHR vendors and their capabilities for influenza data collection, just in case. It's always good to have a backup plan and know what else is out there.
Lunch Break. Grab a quick bite at the hospital cafeteria.

Work on the cost-benefit analysis framework for evaluating the vendor's proposals. Identify key cost drivers and potential benefits. Consult with @itpm-1 to refine the analysis framework. Topic: Cost-Benefit Analysis Framework for EHR Modifications.
Review the feedback received from the Health Informatics Specialists regarding the requirements document and incorporate their suggestions. Make sure everything is clear and technically accurate.
Prepare a presentation summarizing the hospital's requirements for influenza data collection. This will be used during the meeting with the EHR vendor. Include visuals and clear explanations.
Review the presentation and practice my delivery. Make sure I'm prepared to answer any questions the vendor might have. Then start looking for fun things to do in the evening.
